question: You recording this?
answer: Yeah, sure... CHAD, his best bud, aims a BLUE TOOTH VIDEOSTREAMING CELLPHONE at some CUTE GIRLS instead. We can see their faces on the tiny SCREEN of the cellphone. Ryan's car gets caught behind a blue speedster, then passes on the shoulder.

question: Move, bitch. He gets an EXTENDED PLAY and the screen flashes "NEW RECORD." Nearby, a KID watching the game nods. Get that? Ryan turns around to see Chad has shoved the cellphone down the front of his tattered shorts. And he's freeballing it.
answer: Check it; Attack of the Bubblegum Monster in Hi-Def videostream-

question: C'mon Chad, I gotta put my mouth on that. Holding a cup of soda between his teeth, Chad pulls the cellphone out of his pants and hits "SEND".
answer: Sweet. It's going to my email right now. S9me soda inadvertently SPILLS onto the cellphone and Chad wipes it dry on his pants.

question: Watch it dude, I gotta return that thing in seven days.
answer: They aren't giving you shit yet?

question: Nah, whenever I return it, I just list off why the phone sucks and they give me a new model. Figure by the tenth time I'll have to go somewhere else. Ryan's car finally CRASHES in a wall of flames. Game Over.
answer: Go already. No one's looking. His left hand holds his WALLET. Need me to hold that? Ryan sticks it in the pocket of his surfer shorts -- he zips a zipper, tucks a Velcro flap. Pats his pocket proudly.

question: Waterproof. But as soon as Ryan covertly CLIMBS ONTO THE RAIL, his left leg starts trembling like crazy. This is stupid. I could get killed. Pick another dare. Chad lowers the phone, irritated.
answer: My ass. Not after you made me march in the Gay Pride Parade wearing a thong.

question: Screw it then. In one... Two... Two and a half--
answer: Whole numbers only, Rabbitfoot. Ryan stares at the waves crashing below. His leg starts snaking like crazy... And he chickens out, hopping back to the deck. Just so you know, I'm emailing this to every chick you ever met. But suddenly Ryan's oblivious to the dare. His eyes are glued to something else-- Transmitting pussy file now. CHLOE, early 20s, a head turner, confident, funny; she can pull you in like a tractor beam. She and some CUTE FRIENDS carry heavy cardboard boxes toward a table set up for the "Heal The Bay" rally. Ryan walks over like he owns the place.

question: Got any more? I'm here to help.
answer: Thanks, but no, we got 'em all.

question: What's in 'em? Chloe opens the box. Hands him a "Heal The Bay" pamphlet. Cool, you're handing these out during the concert?
answer: Yeah, wanna help? Ryan tries to ignore his thundering heart.

question: Hell yeah. I'm all about "Heal the Bay. " His eyes ricochet off the pamphlet in his hand. Me an Chad do the monthly cleanup thing, of course... An awesome wing-man, Chad appears over Chloe's shoulder, pretending to read a pamphlet, but really holding it up so Ryan can see it. Piece of cake, now. We've collected water samples with the Stream Team, raised money on the Promenade... I'm surprised I haven't seen you. He offers his hand. Ryan. She takes it.
answer: Chloe. The handshake lingers a second longer than necessary, and they both smile at each other. Chad splits. I can't tell if you're full of it. Ryan stops posturing, gets real.

question: You ever go up to Santa Barbara? My dad used to take me there all the time. Their pier is amazing, clear water, huge crabs everywhere, oysters right there on the rocks, starfish... Hard to believe it's the same ocean sometimes. He's managed to win her back.
answer: Maybe you and I can take a break later when Pat Benatar goes on.

question: Sounds like a plan. There's a moment... Then --
answer: Oh no -- I forgot. I still have to pick up a box of T-shirts at the Kinkos on Venice.

question: I'll do it for you... if you want.
answer: Seriously, you would?

question: Sure. How much is the bill?
answer: Nothing. It's been paid up front.

question: Do you promise not to go anywhere?
answer: Done. Ryan makes a graceful exit. Turns back.

question: Okay, I won't be long.
answer: Bye. Ryan grabs Chad, and as they walk out of earshot:

question: Dude, does Santa Barbara have a harbor or a pier? Dex, wassup? You won't believe the hotties I just met at the pier. Smoking. You wanna meet them? Yeah? Well don't get too excited 'cause I need my money. Ryan stops at a red light. Bullshit, you're not going anywhere, I'm pulling up right now. Some AMBULANCES SPEED BY, SIRENS BLARING. It's deafening. Ryan lays on the horn. When the light changes, Ryan peels away angrily. What? Yeah, you better be. And I need your shower, I'm talkin' code red stankage- The CELLPHONE begins to CRACKLE with STATIC just as Ryan drives under an OVERPASS. Suddenly -- The car ahead of him STOPS in the middle of the street. Ryan notices too late and has to jam on the brakes. The car skids, he SCREAMS... and comes to a stop an inch before hitting the other car's bumper. He lifts the phone receiver to his ear but the call is WASHED Dex? You still there...? And as has happened to all of us, he loses the call. Damn. Sorry, got cut off. Hey -- what's my Caller ID say? But there's no voice on the other end, only shuffling sounds. Yo Dex...? Hello...? Jessica's hands go suddenly still, then -- WHOOM! -- her head slams down INTO FRAME on top of the crushed earpiece, a desperate hope filling her eyes. Whatever. Signing off- -- and is just about to hit END CALL when he hears a tiny female voice on the other end.
answer: Wait! Don't hang up! Ryan puts the phone back to his ear.

question: Hello?
answer: There's not much time! I need you to go to the police. My name is Jessica Martin; I've been kidnapped!

question: Oh really? Kidnapped, huh?
answer: Please. I know what you're thinking, but it's real! I'm in an attic somewhere. I think they're going to kill me! You need to-

question: Awfully polite kidnappers to give you a phone... Jessica's voice TREMBLES uncontrollably. Desperate, fearful and frustrated.
answer: No! You don't understand! Suddenly, the cellphone BLIPS twice in Ryan's ear. He pulls it away and looks at its faceplate.

question: If you were really in trouble, you would've called the cops, not me. Now I've got a real call on the other line--
answer: Goddamn it, listen to me! The phone I'm on...it's shattered! There's no dialer! I've been clicking wires together for hours trying to get someone, anyone, and you 're the only connection I was able to make! If you hang up, I may not get anyone else.

question: Hmm. Sucks to be you. Try crank yanking someone else. Late.
answer: Wait! Don't hang up! DON'T HANG UP!! But -- CLICK! Ryan flashes over to the next call.

question: Dex?
answer: Hello, Mr. Ackerman. My name is Mark and I'd like to discuss with you the benefits of Mastercharge Credit Union's-

question: Awesome, I can totally use a credit card. Tell me more.
answer: Absolutely. We've lowered our APR-

question: -Shucks, now's really not a good time, but why don't I get your number and get back to you later.
answer: Sure, it's 818...

question: That's the office number?
answer: Yes.

question: Why don't you give me your number instead. That way I can call you when you're having dinner with your family. A beat.
answer: Sorry to have bothered you. Click! The Telemarketer hangs up.

question: Damn skippy. And that's when he notices the message flashing on the phone's faceplate
answer: --an you hear me?!

question: You still there? You're getting kinda creepy, lady. See ya.
answer: No! Don't! They're going to kill me! They're going to kill me!! A silent beat. A calculated look in her eyes... RYAN pulls the phone from his ear and is about to hang up...when he hears the one sound that stops all men cold. On the other end, Jessica begins to CRY.

question: Oh, it's like that, huh? Nice with the fake tears, lady...
answer: Please... I just need help. But Ryan won't be manipulated.

question: You need acting lessons. Now go take your meds and bug someone else.
answer: These men!!!-- Jessica stops herself short, quieting the rising hysteria in her voice before it gives her away. She glances anxiously at the attic door, then continues, more in control. These men killed my housekeeper. My dog. You have to help me. Ryan bristles at being saddled with anything, much less this.

question: No, actually( I don't. Not with a hot chick waiting for me at the pier.
answer: Please...you're my only hope. What's your name? That catches Ryan off-guard. He stalls, not wanting to make this personal.

question: Why, you writing a book--?
answer: --Please, just tell me your name! Ryan glances around the street, his eyes falling on a stone fountain outside a French Restaurant.

question: Uh...Johnny. Johnny Fountain.
answer: Johnny... What if it was your mother who was calling for help? How would you feel?

question: Well, I'd be damn impressed, considering she's dead.
answer: Goddamn it, how difficult is it to hand this phone off to the police?! I'll pay you!

question: How much?
answer: Five thousand dollars.

question: Sure you will. I'm hanging up now.
answer: No, wait! WAIT!! Even if there's a eighty percent chance I'm lying, you nave a one in five chance to make five grand f9r a lousy twenty minutes of your life. Haven't you ever bet on a horse or bought a Lottery ticket? I'm talking one-in-five odds, twenty minutes. Ryan slaps the radio off.

question: Come on Powell, put the Sharks with the Sharks, the Jets with the Jets and make room. Rookie Powell suppresses his irritation and roughly yanks the Gangbanger back over to the holding cells. Mooney puts down the pizza, no appetite, and stares at the news story playing on the TV mounted in the corner.
answer: Sucks for the fellas at the Two- Three right now, huh?

question: Dirty pricks deserve what they get. Public hates us enough without this shit.
answer: There's good men over there. A FEMALE OFFICER passes Mooney and reaches for his box of pizza.

question: Keep walking, Shelly. Nothing to see here. A friendly tug of war. She'd say nothing, 'cause she's not gonna know about it! Christ, Shel, my old man had eleven heart attacks. Eleven! I have one little infarction and you guys start treating me like an invalid! I'm a grown man! Leave me alone, will you?! I hate this place.
answer: I'm here.

question: is busy doing ten things at once. Signing release papers. Booking a DRUNK whose wife-beater Tee is drenched in blood, Etc.
answer: Excuse me, officer -- But Mooney ignores him in favor of the three cops that suddenly need arrest sheets signed. Hey, I've got an emergency here -- Just then, CREWCUT OFFICER shoulders his way through with a cuffed CRACKHEAD TRANNIE in tow. The Trannie's wrists ache.

question: Christ, I've only got two hands here! Stick him in the can, will ya? Crewcut nods and moves off towards the bathroom.
answer: Come on, man! I've got some lady on the phone here who says she's been kidnapped!

question: Nice try, kid, but I got no time for pranks.
answer: Seriously, a lady was murdered!

question: Which is it, a kidnapping or a murder?
answer: Take the phone and find out moron! A COP snickers somewhere.

question: Oh my God...
answer: What? What is it? Lady, what's going on?! Jessica drops the phone. Has just enough time to shove it behind her before -- SLAM! -- the attic door swings open and two of the masked kidnappers stride in. When they reach her, they stand silently, trying to unnerve her.

question: What? I don't- The masked leader SLAPS HER SHARPLY across the face! Jessica wants to collapse to the ground, but remains sitting TO KEEP THE PHONE HIDDEN behind her. The Leader bends down and yells right in her face. At work! Why, what do you want--? SLAP!!! This one's even nastier than the first.
answer: Oh shit... Panicking, Ryan turns and walks, then jogs, then all-out runs for the station stairwell.

question: Please, he should be at work! That's all I know. The Leader nods, then turns away. Jessica exhales with relief that he didn't spot the phone. But her victory is short-lived as: NO! NO--.'.' STAY AWAY FROM MY SON! Johnny!!
answer: I know. I'm trying to get help.

question: My son -- Suddenly, as Ryan reaches the first landing -- STATIC starts breaking up the call. Oh my God! What's happening?!
answer: It's just static. I'm running upstairs to the detectives. Hold on, I might lose you for a sec--

question: No, don't! Stop. You can't lose me--
answer: Wait, we're almost there.

question: Stop! Johnny, goddamn it, stop!
answer: Well, what the hell am I supposed to do?! Ryan looks at himself, standing on the stairs like an idiot. Jesus! I'm almost there! Ryan checks the SIGNAL STRENGTH INDICATOR on the phone. There's only one bar left. Defiantly, Ryan takes a step UP...and the bar DISAPPEARS. He quickly hops BACK DOWN. Crap! You're shitting me.

question: Johnny, what time is it?! Johnny!
answer: Who? Oh -- one-twenty.

question: Johnny, listen to me. My son's school lets out at 1:45.
answer: Good, then if I get a cop-- Ryan exits the stairwell to find Mooney -- but Mooney's not there anymore! There's some NEW GUY -- and he's SWAMPED!

question: No. There's not enough time. You have to pick him up before they--
answer: Pick him up? Hell no, lady! I ain't goin' nowhere else-- Ryan tries to get the NEW GUY's attention, in a dream.

question: Please please stop standing there! He 's just a little boy!
answer: But I'm in a police station!

question: Where are you now?!
answer: I just got off the 405.

question: You've got to go faster, Johnny!
answer: You've gotta chill! You're stressing the crap out of me! Where the hell is a cop hiding in a speed trap when you need one? Ryan takes a hard right, tires squealing. Pushing it against his better judgment. What do these guys want, anyway?

question: How should I know?!
answer: What do you do?

question: I'm an obstetrician. They don't want anything from me.
answer: So your husband's like, uber-rich?

question: What--? No. He's an accountant. I make more money than he does.
answer: Could they've mistaken you for someone else?

question: No! I don't know. None of this makes any sense. Jessica starts losing it completely, upsetting Ryan so much that he takes the next corner too fast and -- SKKRRASH! --
answer: Oh...SHIT!! Ryan SLAMS on the brakes and SWERVES to avoid hitting a group of workers -- and OBLITERATES THE BRONCO'S PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR against another BARRIER -- Ryan cringes with every muscle! And the mirror ricochets off the ground -- and smashes through the windshield of a recently waxed Acura Legend! ...Ain't that a bitch. As the heavily-muscled workers start running to beat the shit out of him, Ryan floors the gas, sending a shower of wet asphalt all over the cursing workers as he peels away, CRASHING through a FINAL BARRIER. More cautiously, Ryan rounds the next corner and -- There's the school. Ryan's right. Just ahead, we see: Okay, I'm here.

question: How much time do we have? Ryan checks his watch. It reads
answer: Five minutes. What's your kid's name?

question: Ricky.
answer: Ricky what?

question: Martin.
answer: Ricky Martin? You named your kid Ricky Martin?! Why didn't you tattoo "kick me" on his ass while you were at it?

question: He was named before the singer ever-
answer: Forget it. What does he look like?

question: He's eight years old. Blonde hair. Green eyes. Small for his age. He's wearing a light blue shirt and dark blue pants--
answer: They're all wearing blue shirts and pants! Ryan turns down a hallway and we see that he's right. It's filled with IDENTICALLY-UNIFORMED LITTLE BOYS. As a TIMID BLONDE BOY passes in front of him, Ryan grabs him and wheels him around. Ricky Martin? The Boy's eyes get huge. He tries to pull away. No, kid, it's okay! I didn't mean to-- Does he have anything else? A jacket? A backpack? What's his lunch box look like?

question: I don't remember.
answer: You don't remember your own kid's lunch box?!

question: I don't pack it! Rosario, our housekeeper does! Sometimes Craig, but... Jessica begins to sob, which causes Ryan to panic further.
answer: Ricky Martin, where are you!? None of the Stepford kids respond.

question: I wish I could give you more. Now Ryan's running. He yells into a BATHROOM.
answer: Ricky Martin? I'm looking for a little blond boy-- --No, no! Not like that! Oh shit... RICKY MARTIN! DOES ANYONE KNOW WHERE RICKY MARTIN IS?1 I can't believe I'm yelling this at an all- boys school. All hell is breaking loose. The kids ignore him. The huge Gym Teacher races after him. Jessica yells in his ear.

question: Was that the bell? Was that the bell?!
answer: Yes. RICKY! RICKY MARTIN!! Ryan wades through the sea of uniforms.

question: He'11 go to the parents' pick-up spot. Oh God, they're going to get him!
answer: No--! Ryan tugs his arm free and races to the phone. The LCD display GLASS is cracked into a SPIDERWEB. Jessica? You still there?!

question: Yes? Relieved, Ryan turns and races for the front of the school.
answer: No one's gonna get your kid! He's not slow, is he?

question: What--? No!
answer: Then he won't go anywhere with strangers.

question: Unless they have our Escalade. Ricky'11 think it's Rosario and hop right in! She's got a point. Ryan picks up the pace and arrives at the pick-up spot. Scans the lot.
answer: What color?

question: Black!
answer: Of course it is. PAN AROUND to see what Ryan sees -- three black Cadillac Escalades. There's three of them. What's your plate?

question: 4..7..wait, no...3 -- Oh my God, I don't remember!
answer: Like you don't remember the lunch box? Or anything else about your kid-- Oh, man. This is a prank, isn't it?

question: No!
answer: Bullshit! Oh, you're good lady. Your friends too. Getting me to scream out 'Ricky Martin' at a boys school. Damn, you really nailed me.

question: No-- No, Johnny, you have to listen to me-- /.' But Ryan's had enough. He turns to leave --
answer: I'm done being your entertainment for the day. I'm going back to the pier while I still have a chance -- -- and passes right by a blonde-haired, green-eyed, EIGHT- YEAR-OLD BOY carrying a Lord of the Rings lunchbox. Ryan hesitates and is about to stop the kid...but then decides "screw it", and keeps on hoofing. Ryan rounds a corner to leave -- and is confronted by the Gym Teacher and a RENT-A-COP SECURITY GUARD. Stalking?! No, I can explain-- The Rent-a-Cop mumbles into his walkie. Hey, HEY RENT-A-DUDE--!! Hang on a sec! This is a huuuge misunderstanding-- A little RENT-A-COP CAR pulls up in the driveway below. The Security Guard starts forcibly leading Ryan toward it, but as he gets close--

question: Lord of the Rings! I forgot his father bought him a Lord of the Rings lunchbox last week! Ryan's heart stops in his chest. He turns to see the Boy with the Lord or the Rings lunchbox racing down the school steps and up to one of the waiting Escalades.
answer: Oh shit! You just see that?! Losing control of Ryan, the Rent-a-Cop calls to his partner in the car. Goddamn it, that little kid was just kidnapped!! Do something!!

question: What's happening, Ryan?!
answer: Don't worry, I can fix this.

question: Oh my God. There are three cars between Ryan and the Escalade.
answer: It's okay, I can see them ahead.

question: Don't lose them! If you follow them back here, you can tell the police where they're holding us!
answer: Okay.

question: SHIT! Ryan SLAMS on his breaks and is forced to crawl along at a ainful 25 m.p.h.. Worse, he has his view of the Escalade glocked by the bus' titanic silver ass.
answer: Johnny!

question: Damn! There's this stupid bus-- Ryan jags left and right, catching glimpses around the bus of the Escalade still ahead. Come on! But the bus doesn't pull over. Ryan tries flashing the security car's CLEAR BUBBLE LIGHTS on the roof, but who the hell would pull over for that? The bus sure doesn't. Jesus.'
answer: Can't you go around it? There's an ungodly amount of opposing traffic-- But suddenly there's a break in the flow! Seizing the moment, Ryan SLAM-SH IFTS the rent-a -cop car's uni-cylinder engine into gear and starts to tear around the bus -- but has to SWERVE BACK as a SPEEDING TRASH TRUCK rounds a bend and almost creams him!

question: Goddamn it!
answer: What?! Did you lose him? !

question: No, I just almost got killed, is all.
answer: Oh thank God!

question: Hey Tomlin.
answer: Taking off?

question: My anniversary. You know, duty calls; pricey dinner and then some crap-ass play. Hey, I sent some college kid down to see you this morning. Had some rap about a kidnapping --
answer: I haven't seen anyone, but I'll ask around. Kidnapping, huh?

question: I thought it was a prank at first, but the kid was so worked up--
answer: Well, don't you get worked up. If the kid comes back, page me, and I'll be sure to see him.

question: Look, Johnny, you've got to go back to the cops--
answer: Are you high?! I just jacked a car!

question: Goddamn it, stop thinking about just yourself! You can explain everything to them later!
answer: What now? Ryan pulls the phone away from his ear and checks it out. Great! Now the battery's dying.

question: Don't you have a charger?
answer: It's in my car! Hold on. SFX Jesus -- !

question: What's going on? Did you find one?
answer: Not exactly... SFX

question: Johnny, don't lose me!
answer: Well what the hell do you expect me to do?! Just then, Ryan rounds a corner -- and sees traffic GRIDLOCKED to a halt ahead. He tries to maneuver around it, but is almost immediately boxed in.

question: Johnny--!
answer: I know, Jessica! The phone starts a STEADY BEEPING now, dying imminent. And traffic isn't going anywhere. Ryan looks around desperately. Nothing. No emergency lane. No shoulder. Just a long drop down a HILL to a strip mall below-- STRIP MALL?! Ryan scans it and does a double-take on one of the store's signs You know that money you promised me?

question: Yes.
answer: I'm giving myself a raise.

question: What's going on?!
answer: mmmrrmph mrm mrmph! Ryan is bounced around like a corn kernel in a popper until the car hits a jutting rock and -- WHOOOOM! -- goes up on two wheels. It looks like it's going to roll but gravity brings Shit! Ryan scrabbles for the phone -- but gives it up when he bounces over a rise and sees A BILLBOARD DEAD AHEAD! WHOAAAAAA! Ryan whips the wheel and navigates the little car between the billboard's concrete posts, but -- WHAM! -- obliterates the rent-a-cop's BUBBLE LIGHTS on the billboard's lower edge. Somehow, Ryan muscles the bucking econocar safely down the rest of the hill and into the strip mall parking lot, where it SKIDS OUT. Jessica?! Can you hear me?!

question: I'm here! Ryan hops out and races inside--
answer: Excuse me-- Hey! Hey! I've got an emergency here -- Damn it, will you listen to me?! I've got a life and death call on this phone and my battery's dying! Do you have a charger? Bu t-- ! Help, I -- Aw, screw this... -- Ryan pulls the rent-a-cop's big .38 SPECIAL from his pocket and BLOWS THE SMILEY FACE DISPENSER TO DUST! Oh look! Now serving thirty eight special!

question: Whew! That was so no bueno!
answer: You found a charger?

question: Among other things... Ryan glances at piles of phone gear he's appropriated from Verizon. EARBUD MIKES. MANUALS. RECEPTION BOOSTERS.
answer: Thank you for doing all this, Johnny.

question: Yeah, look, about that... My-name isn't really Johnny Fountain.
answer: Good, it sounded like a porn star name. It's okay. I know. You don't have to tell me --

question: It's Ryan. Ryan Ackerman. I'm a bar-back. I'm twenty-two, and just a little freaked out right now. Jessica is moved with emotion by his honesty.
answer: Thank you, Ryan. But before they can say any more, suddenly--

question: N-no... Jessica scoots away, trying to draw Greer's eyes in another direction from the phone that lies OUT IN THE OPEN. ...but I am going to, aren't I?
answer: Up to you. Your husband left a message asking you to meet him in left field. Where's that?

question: What? I don't understand--? Greer winds up and BAM! Hits Jessica in the stomach, knocking the wind out of her and causing her to fall to the ground.
answer: --A base ball field !? Wh ich o ne does he mean?!

question: I... I don't know what you want me to say. I swear--
answer: Shut up!!! Which field?! He wouldn't leave a message that didn't make sense to you! Greer tightens his fist and is about to hit Jessica again--

question: Wait! The bleachers behind left field at Dodger Stadium! That's where we first met. Please! Believe me. That has to be where he means. I swear to God. Then he stands, looking away for just a moment -- but long enough for Jessica to NUDGE the phone back behind the beam!
answer: Working in my profession as long as I have, you begin to recognize the truth when you hear it. Jessica, trembling, hangs on Greer's every word. Go to the window, Jessica. There's something I want you to see. Relieved at hiding the phone, Jessica gets up and moves to the attic window -- and GASPS.

question: You won't get away with this. When I didn't show up at the hospital, someone must have called the police--
answer: The police are the last people on earth I'm worried about... Greer pulls a Police Scanner out of his jacket and shows it to Jessica. We get one hit on the scanner about you, we'll be picking out family plots, comprende? Suddenly, a HUMMER, with the BASS THUMPING at ear-shattering decibels, pulls alongside Ryan's car. DMX.

question: Do you honestly expect me to believe we're going to walk away from this alive? But Greer isn't listening to her. He strides back into the room, listening to the noise under her voice.
answer: Shut up.

question: Jessica...? Answer me, goddamn it I Soon, his voice pierces the suffocating gloom around her and she crawls desperately over to it.
answer: I'm here.

question: You all right?! I thought they--
answer: I'm okay.

question: What are you doing? Why'd you lie to them?
answer: Do you think I like gambling with my son's life?

question: I can't tell. You seem pretty good at it --
answer: Don't you see, Ryan? Once they get Craig, we're all gonna die.

question: You can't know that for sure.
answer: Be realistic. Does letting us live benefit them in any way? No! The only chance he's got is if you can get to the airport and find him before they do.

question: Wait, wait--!
answer: Ryan, please! There's no time! Just get to the airport--

question: It's suicide. They'll kill me! Lady, I've jacked two cars, been accused of being a child molester, obliterated a car dealership, and busted three caps in a Verizon store. -- Don't tell me I'm not trying! Jessica tries another tack.
answer: Look, I have no right to ask you this Ryan, but you re my family's only chance...and I am asking. Something in the way she says that last sentence, a mixture of strength and vulnerability, gets through to Ryan. And against his own will, he's swayed.

question: Ms. Martin?
answer: Yes?

question: Jessica Kate Martin? The Woman nods. Mooney is plainly disillusioned by the woman. Maybe his hunch was wrong...
answer: Cam I help you, Officer...? She scans Mooney's badge.

question: Hello?
answer: It's Bayback. Remember the Fusco brothers? Silence. Well, I've got an itch that needs scatching.

question: What's the problem?
answer: We're in the middle of a shit storm, and I need you to put a leash put on an officer.

question: Who?
answer: An Officer Mooney from your division. Know him? Now, we start PULLING BACK, revealing the man's features.

question: Mooney? He's a desk sergeant. What would you want with him?
answer: I had to do a B & E and he came snooping around the house looking for the owner.

question: And what did you say?
answer: That I was her, of course. Continue PULLING BACK. We can almost recognize him now...

question: Did he believe you?
answer: I think so. He said he thought someone was pulling a prank on him.

question: Where are you now?!
answer: I'll be at the airport in twenty minu --

question: Twenty minutes! Oh my God, Ryan, you've got to drive faster! Please--
answer: Jessica, this car has a sewing machine for an engine! I can't go any faster!

question: Sorry. I just...
answer: Jessica... ? There's an emotional beat, then--

question: Do you think God will forgive me?
answer: What do you mean--?

question: For what I've done... For giving up Craig... Ryan is moved by the emotion in her voice.
answer: Jessica, they have your kid. You had no choice.

question: I don't know. I don't know...
answer: 1 know. I heard what they were doing to you over there. You held out for as long as you could.

question: My son and I are going to die here, Ryan. They already have us. But maybe I could've saved Craig... The truth of this has a profound effect on Ryan. And just when Jessica is about to lose herself to despair -- Ryan finds a resolve within himself even he didn't know he had.
answer: Jessica, listen to me. I promise you, I'm not going to let that happen. I could care less about your money. I'm risking my life cause I know I'm gonna get you and your family out of this. You hear what I'm sayin'?

question: Get off my line! Are you there? Mom? I
answer: Listen dude, this woman's in serious --

question: --That's not my problem, lady. Lady?! Suddenly, STATIC starts drowning out Ryan's side of the call.
answer: Jessica, don't hang up! You hear me?! Whatever happens --

question: Look woman, tell your kidnapping story to someone who gives a shit. Ryan can't hear Jessica's side of the conversation; only the British Asshole's, which comes in loud and clear.
answer: Jessica?! Jessica?! As Ryan goes mental, a CAR PASSES HIM on the opp9site side of the road -- a new Cadillac XLR convertible! Inside is an appropriately asshole-ish looking guy. He could only be the British Asshole. Gotcha. Ryan pulls a HARROWING 180 DEGREE TURN, barely missing an oncoming car by inches. He RACES up to the Cadillac, which has a VANITY PLATE that reads, "IDOL MKR." Ryan looks through the window at --

question: Jessica?! Jessica?! As Ryan goes mental, a CAR PASSES HIM on the opp9site side of the road -- a new Cadillac XLR convertible! Inside is an appropriately asshole-ish looking guy. He could only be the British Asshole. Gotcha. Ryan pulls a HARROWING 180 DEGREE TURN, barely missing an oncoming car by inches. He RACES up to the Cadillac, which has a VANITY PLATE that reads, "IDOL MKR." Ryan looks through the window at --
answer: Murdered your housekeeper? Don't bullshit me; I work in the Industry that invented it you stupid COW! Ryan sees Simon Cowell MOUTH THE WORDS "STUPID COW" in synch with the conversation. BINGO! Ryan floors the Rent-a-cop car ahead of the Cadillac and PULLS A 90 DEGREE turn at an intersection; cutting Cowell off! SCREEEECH! Cowell, trying to avoid a collision, SLAMS on the brakes, causing the Cadillac to SKID twenty feet. Ryan jumps out of the rent-a-cop car he's left in the middle or the intersection and runs over to the Cadillac, banging on the window with the .38 Special. Cowell practically jumps out of his skin at the sight of the gun and the kid with the crazy look in his eyes. BLOODY HELL!!

question: Give me that phone... or I shoot your car! Cowell is prepared to comply -- but suddenly behind them-- Ain't that a bitch! Ryan turns back to Simon Cowell. Out of the car! Now! Cowell all but dives out. Where's your phone?!
answer: It's on speaker! Ryan turns to the car. Calls out.

question: I thought they... I thought I was--
answer: You're okay. It's okay now. I'm here... Oh shit! SCREEEECH! Ryan steps on the brakes, seeing something ahead. WHIP PAN AROUND to see what Ryan's staring at. Just ahead, JESSICA'S ESCALADE is pulling up to the curb.

question: What?
answer: Your car's here. Ryan pulls along side the red curb and watches as four tough- looking men exit the vehicle. We recognize them as Greer, Deason, Ellis and Hodges.

question: Hurry, Ryan! Just find Craig! Ryan hops out -- but stops when the car CALLS OUT TO HIM. Wait, Ryan! What about me--?! Ryan searches the car and finds the HANDSET in the armrest. As he grabs it and races after Greer into the airport, a Traffic Cop comes up to the car.
answer: Oops. Excuse me. Pardon me. My grandmother needs her walker... Soon, he makes his way to the front, right behind Greer and BUMPS into him. As he does, NOTICE -- ECU of Ryan slyly slipping the rent-a-cop's tiny .38 Special into Greer's heavy motorcycle jacket. Greer turns, glaring -- But no one's there. Greer looks around, and there's a heart-stopping moment that we're afraid he's going to notice Ryan, who now stands innocently the next line over-- --but Greer's eyes pass right over him as he scans the crowd. Ryan breathes a sigh of relief as Greer finally turns away to walk through the metal detector and...

question: "Left Field" is in Terminal C.
answer: Listen to me! They're clearing the terminal. Before your husband passes me, what does he look like?

question: He's thirty-eight. Six feet. Trim build. Thinning hair...
answer: That's not enough! What's he wearing?

question: I don't know! We have completely different schedules. I was fast aslee p-- -- A suit... He wears glasses, thick rims, like Buddy Holly or-- Bingo! The Buddy Holly glasses is what did it. Ryan sees a man in the distance hurrying in his direction -- CRAIG.
answer: Found him! But --

question: Hey, can I go now? Can I go?! The Guard nods, and Ryan takes off like a shot, racing back towards the bar. Ryan spots Craig Martin outside the Left Field sports bar. Ryan grabs him by the elbow and starts hustling him through the concourse.
answer: Hey, what the hell?! Get your hands off m--!!

question: Shut up and keep walking. If they see us they'll kill us both.
answer: What--?

question: Your wife sent me.
answer: She did? But how--?

question: Would you hurry your ass?! You need to hide. They're here, and they're looking for you. They already have your family. Craig looks at him, growing terrified. In here!
answer: I don't understand--

question: It's okay. She'll explain it to you. Okay, Jessica, I'm handing you over now.
answer: Ryan, you've done so much. I don't know how to repay you... An awkward, emotional pause falls between them.

question: Forget about the cash. Just get you and y9ur son home safely and we'll call it even.
answer: I will. I promise.

question: Who, what?... No one! Nobody!
answer: Answer me! Greer looks around the crowded airport.

question: I'll forget I saw anything, just leave them alone! Whatever. Greer manhandles Craig toward the exit.
answer: For your family's sake, you better not have done anything stupid. RYAN snatches the phone from the bogus Craig Martin -- and hauls ass through a sea of travelers, trying to catch up to --

question: You goddamn animals better not have hu rt -- Greer surprises him with a vicious ELBOW to the face.
answer: Animals? Ellis whips a burlap hood over Craig's head and they drive off just as--

question: Yes. He said you looked distracted when you left. He wants you to relax, Bob. He said they found that kid you were looking for and that you were right, it was all a prank. Nothing to worry about.
answer: Yeah, I know. She pulls him back down for another kiss.

question: What am I gonna do with you?
answer: You're gonna dance with me all night long, until we're too pooped to pop... Well almost. A giggle. They kiss.

question: You'll never change.
answer: Yes I will, after I shower. They both share a laugh.

question: Goddamn it, what the hell are you people going to--
answer: Craig? Craig stops dead, hearing the voice. Scans the cobweb-filled room, seeing nothing -- then from the depths of the shadows, Jessica materializes looking haunted and lifeless as a ghost.

question: Jessica? Jessica races for the safety of Craig's arms, but just as she's about to be embraced, Greer steps forward and YANKS Jessica back by her hair. She squeals in pain. HEY --/ / Craig moves to object, but -- OOF! -- Deason sends him gasping to the floor with a sledgehammer fist to the gut.
answer: No, don't hurt him! Jessica struggles and, with an annoyed shove, Greer sends her spilling into Craig. She hugs tightly against him. When Craig gets his wind back, he comes to his knees and manages to croak out--

question: Ricky...? Jessica nods gravely. He's here, too. Craig looks at his wife's face, bruised and hurt, and tears rise in his eyes. Oh, God, Jess... What have they done to you? But Jessica won't let this moment be about pity.
answer: Who are they, Craig? Craig doesn't know what to say. Tell them, Craig. Tell them they have the wrong family. Tell them they've made a mistake-- But something in his eyes disagrees. What?! What is it?

question: In five minutes, I'll need you to give me a hand.
answer: Whenever you're ready, hon. Still wearing his holster, he shifts uncomfortably on the bed as he watches the news. What..? Mooney watches as they continue to detail Ryan's "wild crime spree", but gets the bigger picture, realizing that every event --the Verizon store; searching for the Martin kid; I need the phone number for a residence. Jessica Martin in Brentwood. The woman at the house didn't have an accent. Marilyn smiles, realizing he's really talking to himself. Mooney hangs up, thoughts racing. He reaches behind him, and without looking he grabs his wallet and keys. He then walks over to Marilyn and kisses the top of her head. She knows him, and knows something's up. I'm sorry honey( but I have to check on something real quick.

question: You've got to be kidding-
answer: Delay the reservation if you have to; I'll be back in twenty minutes. And Mooney's gone...

question: Me?
answer: You waiting for a package? Now everyone's looking at Ryan. Including Greer.

question: Sure, uh... I'm supposed to pick something up for Mr. Fountain over at the Bonaventure.
answer: From what department?

question: I'm not sure... They said it was a contract, though, I know that, so what would that be, Legal?
answer: What's the tracking number?

question: You believe this? Everyone's got their head up their ass over there. The Mail Clerk ignores him almost as much as Greer wants to. Greer opens his cellphone to make a call, but when the signal is no good, he wanders outside the mailroom toward the window at the end of the hall.
answer: Sir? You think you could just go outside and get your clipboard? Just then, Hodges and Craig come marching out of the vault. Sir? Ryan glances at Greer, momentarily distracted on the phone. At Hodges, almost out of the bank. As he and Craig near the door -- Sir!?

question: Screw the package. Ryan stands and, unable to find anything better, snatches a metal HAND TRUCK sitting by the door, and as Hodges walks by--
answer: WHAT ARE YOU DOING--?! -- swings it full-force into Hodges' face -- WHAMM!! Hodges drops like a slaughterhouse cow. Instantly, employees hit the ground; scream; run for their lives. Craig dives for the DVD case. The Security Guard has come to life; drawing down on them.

question: Ryan... ? Ryan, please answer me I But Ryan just sits there. Afraid to move. Terrified to discuss Craig. You have to talk to me! Ryan, please you have to talk to me--.' The sweat from his hands causes the tiniest SLIP -- and as he catches himself, there is a soft metallic BOOOONG from the stressed metal. Unable to ignore her pleas any longer, Ryan carefully pulls the cellphone from his pocket and presses it to his ear. Desperate to console her, Ryan -- BANG!! The TARPAPER ROLL flies down the chute. Ryan looks up to see it angrily launching itself right at him! He has to let go of the walls to avoid being hit. He presses himself to one side but -- WHAM!! The bloodthirsty roll bashes his wrist -- and he DROPS Ryan?! OH MY GOD, RYAN?! RYAN--?!
answer: WHAT THE--?! WHIP PAN DOWN to what Deason sees YOU STUPID BITCH! Jessica hurls the phone receiver away. WHO HAVE YOU TOLD?! WHO HAVE YOU

question: NO, DON 'T H URT M E-- Deason roars up and grabs Jessica's neck with one hand. HURLS her across the attic and into the OLD MIRROR, shattering it in a million pieces around her. Desperate for anything, Jessica PALMS a TINY SHARD as she struggles to her feet. A two-inch chip.
answer: YOU AND YOUR KID ARE DEAD! She lowers her arm, defeated, out of breath... You win.

question: Don't hurt me, and I'll do anything... Anything.. . There is a promise in what Jessica offers that Deason responds to. His fist FLASHES toward her throat, making her flinch. But rather than hitting her, he wraps his meaty fingers around her throat, almost daring her to stop him. Jessica trembles, but that is all, and just as Deason begins to enjoy his work, Jessica JABS at his face, but he predicted as much and easily moves to deflect it -- SNICKK! -- she flicks her wrist up and SLICES the underside of his upper arm. Deason flinches a little bit, like a bee sting, then laughs as he notices the tiny SHARD in her hand--
answer: Oooh. --but that's when he HEARS it. A DRIPPING SOUND. Deason looks down at his arm and is confused to see his entire shirt sleeve SOAKED IN BLOOD. It literally pours from his arm onto the floor like a river. Deason drains white; dizzy. He looks at Jessica, confused.

question: Baby, listen to me. I want you to get away from this window. I want you to go to the other side of the room as far away from the door as you can --
answer: No, don't leave me! Don't leave me!! The terror in his voice breaks Jessica's heart.

question: Honey, I'm getting you out of there!
answer: Where are you going?!

question: What the hell, Moon? It's all over the radio.
answer: Jack, she didn't identify herself.

question: What are you saying?
answer: I shot a cop! Dana Bayback. From the 23rd. She was one of the kidnappers. Tomlin looks stunned by the revelation.

question: Let me call the tw9~three. See what the hell's going on. Tomlin pulls out a cellphone.
answer: I hate to think more cops are involved, but--

question: Did she say anything about the Martin woman?
answer: ...Never got the chance. Detective Tomlin frowns.

question: Shut up and listen to me, asswipe. I got what you want. You know who this is, shithead!
answer: Look, sir, we can take your name off our list if you want, but you don't have to get nasty--

question: What--? Who is this?
answer: Mark. At Mastercharge Credit Union-

question: Look, Captain, we've got to do everything we can to protect this guy. I mean, shit, with all his years in he's owed a little. Said something about a kid who came into the station earlier-- Greer grimaces, putting it together.
answer: Early twenties? Stumbled out of Brian Wilson's hamper?

question: Yeah. Something like that.
answer: Tomlin. Take care of him. No witnesses. That's more than Tomlin bargained for.

question: Are you sure that's necessary, sir?
answer: You know once the shitstorm starts, there's nothing I can do to save you.

question: Bad timing, Tomlin. But it isn't Tomlin on the phone this time. It's--
answer: Feel like a trade?

question: The mysterious bike messenger. How did you get this number? In the Cadillac, PUSH IN on Ryan t9 show the CELLPHONE MANUAL he picked up at the Verizon store in his hand.
answer: Gotta love modern technology... My new phone knows the numbers of the last fifty incoming calls.

question: What do you want?
answer: Just the woman and her kid.

question: Who are you? What's your name?
answer: My name is F you. I've got your shit, pal, it doesn't work that way.

question: Fine. Your loss. Nice talking to you. And Ryan hangs up. He waits nervously, sweating, staring at the phone for the longest seconds of his life-- Ring. C'mon, damn it, ring! RING! Then it does. Ryan waits a couple rings, slowing his speeding heart, then nonchalantly picks up.
answer: So, how do you want to do this?

question: Put on a big ass Ronald McDonald smile, apologize to the kid and the woman and bring 'em to the Santa Monica pier.
answer: No. Somewhere quieter.

question: Dude, you're lucky I'm still talkin' to your sorry ass. You do as I say, exactly as I say, or I hang up now and slap this bitch on Nightline, you know what I'm sayin'? There's a long beat.
answer: Fine. But you come alone.

question: Done.
answer: How will I recognize you?

question: You let me worry about that. What's your cell number?
answer: 555-8342. An hour then?

question: County will have a six hour wait. Ten if they know you're a cop. Mooney grunts his gratitude as Tomlin heads toward a wasteland of warehouses. And just as any potential witnesses vanish from sight -- Tomlin's cellphone RINGS! He lowers the gun and answers the call. Yeah?
answer: Is it taken care of?

question: Not yet.
answer: Good. We're making a trade with the kid at the Santa Monica Pier. Your boy can ID the kid for us. Bring him down.

question: Only take the kid out if it's clean. No guess work. The last thing we need's a stampede. Greer paces anxiously -- when suddenly his Nextel RINGS. He answers it, though it's hard to hear over the music. You here?
answer: Yeah.

question: How do you want to do this?
answer: First show me that Jessica and the kid are okay.

question: Do you have the disc?
answer: Yes. Where are they?

question: See the black van at the bottom of the bridge? Passenger side window.
answer: Hang on. Okay, got it. Greer muffles the phone against his leg. Whispers to Ellis:

question: He's around the passenger side. Have you found him yet?
answer: No. I don't know what the hell he looks like!

question: He's the one on the cellphone, you idiot 1
answer: Everyone's on a cellphone! I've got like fifty possible targets here! Ellis' cross hairs flit from one person on a cell, to another, to another...

question: Your turn. Now you show me something.
answer: No. Put them on the Ferris wheel. I want to see them safe first.

question: That wasn't part of the deal.
answer: Deal's changed. I've been thinking. Does me no good to hand over the DVD and then you and the funky bunch take us out. -x

question: I swore I wouldn't do that.
answer: Like you swore to protect and serve? The reference brings Greer up short. There's a moment, then:

question: You know a lot...
answer: And I'll forget a lot, too. But not until they're both out of danger. Now PAN AROUND TO REVEAL Ryan among the crowd, wearing a SURFING WINDBREAKER; HOODED with WATERPROOF POCKETS -- but where's his cellphone? Moving closer, we see Ryan's wearing the EARBUD MIKE from the Verizon store. With the earbud concealed under the loose hood, Ryan looks like anyone else just watching the show. Your choice, man. The Martins or the DVD. Either way, I'm not hanging around any longer. You got five seconds, then I disconnect your ass.

question: Oooh, I think I just pissed myself. Ryan looks optimistic when Hodges gets out and opens the back door. And just as he's on the brink of success--
answer: There you are! Where the hell were you! ?

question: Chloe! Get away from here!
answer: Know how many hours I waited for you to bring back those stupid shirts?! What'd you do? Sell them on the Prominade yourself--? But Ryan's got no time for this.

question: Hey man, your shitty day is about to get a whole lot shittier. Ryan flips open his phone and on the SCREEN plays the SECURITY FOOTAGE of the murder in the parking lot. We see that Ryan must've copied the DVD with his videophone. Ain't that a bitch? And through the tears, Jessica manages a laugh. A small one. But enough to let us know everything's going to be okay. And as we PULL BACK on the scene--
answer: """How does it feel to be a hero?

question: It hurts... But you're making it way better. I'm just glad it's over.
answer: Modesty can be sexy.

question: And to think this was our first date.
answer: Next time, skip the shower. In the background, Jessica and Ricky exit a hospital room and join the two lovebirds.
